intro: Amomum queenslandicum, commonly known as the Queensland ginger, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers, and is characterized by its aromatic rhizomes. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. Amomum queenslandicum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is found in rainforests across eastern Australia.
